question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Network] The RPC response at line 143 is matched without cryptographic verification - can a man-in-the-middle attacker forge responses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Network] If the network_request_timeout_ms config at line 137 is set very high, can this be exploited to lock up subscription threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Network] Are there rate limits on subscription requests? Can an attacker spam subscription attempts to exhaust publisher resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Network] The subscription request at line 136 is simply ConsensusObserverRequest::Subscribe with no additional authentication - can any network peer subscribe? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Resource] peers_with_failed_attempts at line 125 accumulates all failed peers - can this vector grow unbounded in adversarial scenarios? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Authentication] There's no signature or proof-of-work verification in subscription requests - can any peer claim to be a validator and receive subscriptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Authentication] No validator set membership check is performed before subscribing - can non-validator peers become subscription targets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Config] MAX_PING_LATENCY_SECS is hardcoded to 10000.0 at line 30 - is this value safe from causing sort order manipulation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Config] The network_request_timeout_ms is read from config without validation - can a zero or negative timeout cause immediate failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Logic] The retain() operation at line 96 is O(n) per iteration - can this lead to O(nÂ²) complexity with many failed peers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Logic] At line 74, the check 'if sorted_potential_peers.is_empty()' happens inside the loop - can this break prematurely when more retries should occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/subscription_utils.rs] [Logic] The loop at line 72 iterates num_subscriptions_to_create times, but if peers run out, it breaks early - is the return value correctly indicating partial success? (Low)
